episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about the novel Dune's publishing history, the largest known star called WOH G64, vegetarian goose in 18th century Japan, and the phenomenon of Bruceploitation following Bruce Lee's death.

facts.fact: The novel Dune, one of the greatest sci-fi novels ever, was rejected 20 times before being printed by a publisher who specialised in car repair manuals.
The largest known star is 3,000 times wider than the sun, and is coincidentally called "WOW!"
In 18th century Japan, you could eat vegetarian goose.
After Bruce Lee died, Chinese movie studios tried to exploit the gap he left by immediately releasing films starring Bruce Lai, Lee Bruce, and Brut Lee.
